turns.speaker: MERYL
turns.text: So what do we do for money when we get to New Orleans?

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: I've got my Seahaven Bankcard.

turns.speaker: MERYL
turns.text: So we just eat into our savings, is that the idea?  I'd better call your mother when we get there.  She'll be worried sick - I don't know how she's going to take this.

turns.speaker: MERYL
turns.text: Let me get you some help, Truman.  You're not well.

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: Why do you want to have a child with me? You can't stand me.

turns.speaker: MERYL
turns.text: That's not true.

turns.speaker: MERYL
turns.text: Why don't I make you some of this new Mococoa Drink?  All natural.  Cocoa beans from the upper slopes of Mount Nicaragua. No artificial sweeteners--

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: --What the hell are you talking about?!

turns.speaker: MERYL
turns.text: I've tasted other cocoas.  This is the best.

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: What the hell has that got to do with anything?  Tell me what's happening?!

turns.speaker: MERYL
turns.text: You're having a nervous breakdown, that's what's happening.

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: You're part of this, aren't you?!

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: Stop this now.  I'll do it.  I swear.

turns.speaker: MERYL
turns.text: Do something...

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: Who were you talking to?!

turns.speaker: MERYL
turns.text: You're the one talking to the walls!

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: No.  You said, "Do something."  Who were you talking to?  Tell me!

turns.speaker: MERYL
turns.text: Truman, stop it!

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: --What are my plans now? Well, next I'm thinking of tackling the Yuba River in an authentic canoe from the Algonquin tribe. --I'm talking about the north fork, a class five rapid - only I'm not going down the Yuba, I'm going up. Do you honestly think for one minute I'd go back to some dreary office to rubber stamp meaningless documents...do you?

turns.speaker: MERYL
turns.text: --Truman, you're gonna be late!

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: How are you, Mother?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Well, I made it through another night.

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: How's your hip?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Oh, just so.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: You know surprises aren't good for me. You should really call before you come over, dear.

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: I've got something to tell you.  You'd better sit down.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: You look very pale, Truman.  Are you taking your vitamin D's?

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: I spend half my life out in the sun, Mother, why would I need vitamin D?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: I feel certain my condition runs in the family.  Can't this wait, dear?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: It doesn't sound insane, Truman.  I swear I see him ten times a week--in a hundred faces.  I almost hugged a perfect stranger in the salon last Thursday.

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: It was Dad, I swear, dressed like a homeless man.  And you know what else was really strange?  A businessman and a woman with a little dog appeared from nowhere and forced him onto a bus.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: About time they started cleaning up the trash Downtown.  We don't want to end up like the rest of the country.

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: They never found Dad's body--maybe somehow--

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: --Darling--

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: I'm telling you, if it wasn't him, it was his twin.  Did Dad have a brother?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: You know he was an only child, like you.  I know how bad you feel about what happened--sailing into that storm.  But I don't blame you, Truman.  I never have.

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: We ought to be getting you back, Mother.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Hold on a minute, dear.  Here's us at Mount Rushmore.  You remember, Truman--when Dad was still with us - that was quite a drive.  You slept all the way there.

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: It looks so small.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Things always do--when you look back.

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: I'm looking for my wife--Nurse Burbank. It's important.

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: I'm afraid that's impossible--she's in pre-op.

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: Sure.  Okay.  Fine.  Can you pass on a message?

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: I'll try.

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: Tell her, tell her...I had to go to Fiji. I'll call her when I get there.

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: When you get to Fiji?

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: You got it.

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: Fine.  I'll tell her.

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: Now what?

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Leak at the plant.  They had to shut her down.

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: Is there any way around?

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: The whole area's being evacuated.

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: Well, thank you for your help.

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: You're welcome, Truman.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: They're coming.  Any minute.

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: They're going to stop me talking to you.

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: There's no one here.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Just listen.  You remember when you were a little boy, you stood up in class and said you wanted to be an explorer like Magellan--

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: --How do you know about that?

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: --And your teacher said, "You're too late, Truman.  There's nothing left to explore."

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: Were you there--how do you know?

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: --It doesn't matter.  Everybody knows about it.  They know everything you do. The point is, you got scared.

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: You must listen.  Everybody's pretending, Truman.

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: How's it going, Truman?

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: Not bad.  I just won the State Lottery.

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: Good.  Good.

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: Tyrone, what if I said I didn't want meatball today?

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: I'd ask for identification.

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: See you tomorrow, Truman.

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: You can count on it.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Do you live around here?

turns.speaker: 2ND BOY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: 2ND BOY
turns.text: Not supposed to talk about it.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: You're not supposed to talk about it? Who told you that?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I think you better tell us.

turns.speaker: 2ND BOY
turns.text: We don't even know you.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Well, we're FBI agents.

turns.speaker: 2ND BOY
turns.text: You're not FBI agents.

turns.speaker: BARMAID
turns.text: Poopy day?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Yup.

turns.speaker: BARMAID
turns.text: A woman?  Work.

turns.speaker: BARMAID
turns.text: What do you do?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: What do I do.  I'm a key figure in an ongoing government charade. An annoyance to my superiors. A joke among my peers. "Spooky," they call me. Spooky Mulder. Whose sister was abducted by aliens when he was a kid. Who now chases little green men with a badge and a gun, shouting to the heavens and anyone who'll listen that the fix is in. That our government's hip to the truth and a part of the conspiracy. That the sky is falling and when it hits it's gonna be the shitstorm of all time.

turns.speaker: BARMAID
turns.text: I think that about does it, Spooky.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Does what?

turns.speaker: BARMAID
turns.text: Why don't you go home to the old lady --

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Sorry. Don't have one.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: What am I doing here?

turns.speaker: BYERS
turns.text: You were shot in the head. The bullet broke the flesh on your right brow and glanced off your temporal plate.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Penetration but not perforation.

turns.speaker: BYERS
turns.text: They gave you a craniotomy to relieve the pressure from a subdural hematoma. But you've been unconscious since they brought you in.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: When was that?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Scully had a violent reaction to a bee sting --

turns.speaker: BYERS
turns.text: You called 911. Except the call was intercepted.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: They took her --

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: I need your clothes, Byers.

turns.speaker: BYERS
turns.text: Me?

turns.speaker: CASSIDY
turns.text: Special Agent Scully --

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I apologize for making you wait -- I've brought some new evidence with me --

turns.speaker: CASSIDY
turns.text: Evidence of what?

turns.speaker: CASSIDY
turns.text: You've been back to Dallas?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: CASSIDY
turns.text: Are you going to let us in on what exactly you're trying to prove --

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: That the bombing in Dallas may have been to destroy the bodies of those firemen, so their deaths and the reason for them wouldn't have to be explained --

turns.speaker: CASSIDY
turns.text: -- those are very serious allegations, Agent Scully --

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Yes. I know.

turns.speaker: CASSIDY
turns.text: And you have conclusive evidence of this? Something to tie this claim of yours to the crime --

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Nothing completely conclusive --

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I hope to. We're working to develop this evidence --

turns.speaker: CASSIDY
turns.text: Working with?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Agent Mulder.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: What is it you find incredible?

turns.speaker: CASSIDY
turns.text: Well...where would you like me to start? Antarctica is a long way from Dallas, Agent Scully. I can't very well submit a report to the Attorney General that alleges the links you've made here. Bees and corn crops do not quite fall under the rubric of domestic terrorism.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: No, they don't.

turns.speaker: CASSIDY
turns.text: Most of what I find in here is lacking a coherent picture of an organization with an attributable motive. I realize you're very lucky to be alive Agent Scully. The ordeal you've endured has clearly affected you -- though the holes in your account leave this panel with little choice but to delete these references from our final report to the Justice Department. Until which time hard evidence becomes available that would give us cause to pursue such an investigation.

turns.speaker: CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
turns.text: You've got something to show me.

turns.speaker: DR. BRONSCHWEIG
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DR. BRONSCHWEIG
turns.text: We brought the atmosphere back down to freezing in order to control the development, which is nothing like we've ever seen.

turns.speaker: CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
turns.text: Brought on by what?

turns.speaker: DR. BRONSCHWEIG
turns.text: Heat, I think. The coincident invasion of a host, the fireman, and an environment that raised his basic body temperature above ninety eight point six.

turns.speaker: CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
turns.text: This man's still alive.

turns.speaker: DR. BRONSCHWEIG
turns.text: Technically and biologically, though he'll never recover.

turns.speaker: CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
turns.text: How can this be?

turns.speaker: DR. BRONSCHWEIG
turns.text: The developing organism is using his life energy, digesting bone and tissue. We've just slowed the process.

turns.speaker: DR. BRONSCHWEIG
turns.text: Do you want me to destroy this one, too? Before it gestates?

turns.speaker: CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
turns.text: No. No...we need to try our vaccine on it.

turns.speaker: DR. BRONSCHWEIG
turns.text: And if it's unsuccessful?

turns.speaker: CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
turns.text: Incinerate it. Like the others.

turns.speaker: DR. BRONSCHWEIG
turns.text: This man's family will want to see the body laid to rest.

turns.speaker: CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
turns.text: Tell them he was trying to save the young boy's life, and that he died heroically like the other firemen.

turns.speaker: DR. BRONSCHWEIG
turns.text: Of what?

turns.speaker: CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
turns.text: They seemed to buy our story about the Hanta virus. You'll make sure the families are taken care of financially, along with a sizeable donation to the community.  Maybe a small roadside memorial.

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
turns.text: We have a situation. The members are assembling.

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: Is it an emergency?

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: Who called this meeting?

turns.speaker: CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
turns.text: Strughold. He's just gotten on a plane in Tunis.

turns.speaker: CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
turns.text: Its effect on the host has changed. The virus no longer just invades the brain as a controlling organism. It's developed a way to modify the host body.

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: Into what?

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: My lateness may have well been absence. A course has already been taken.

turns.speaker: CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
turns.text: There are complications.

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: Do they know?

turns.speaker: CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
turns.text: Mulder was in Dallas when we were trying to dispose of evidence. He's gone back there again. Someone has tipped him.

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
turns.text: Kurtzweil, we think.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Is this Dr. Kurtzweil's residence?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE
turns.text: You got some kind of business with him?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: I'm looking for him.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE
turns.text: Looking for him for what?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE
turns.text: Feds are looking for him, too.  Real nice business he's got, huh?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE
turns.text: Selling naked pictures of little kids over his computer.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE
turns.text: You looking for him for some other reason?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Yeah, I had an appointment for a pelvic examination.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE
turns.text: You want a call if we turn up Kurtzweil?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: No. Don't bother.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: I'm looking for anything out of the ordinary. Maybe something from the FEMA offices where the bodies were found.

turns.speaker: FIELD AGENT
turns.text: We weren't expecting to find those remains, of course. They went right off to Washington.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Was there anything in those offices that didn't go to D.C.?

turns.speaker: FIELD AGENT
turns.text: Some bone fragments came up in the sift this morning. We thought there'd been another fatality, but we found out FEMA had recovered them from an archeological site out of town.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Have you examined them?

turns.speaker: FIELD AGENT
turns.text: No. Just fossils, far as I know.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: You said you knew the location of the archeological site where these were found.

turns.speaker: FIELD AGENT
turns.text: Show you right on a map.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: How's that?

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: Standing around holding your yank while bombs are exploding.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Do I know you?

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: No. I've been watching your career for a good while. Back when you were just a promising young agent -- before that.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: You follow me out here for a reason?

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: Yeah, I did.

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: My name's Kurtzweil. Dr. Alvin Kurtzweil.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: I know the name. Why?

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: Old friend of your father's.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: How'd you find me?

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: Heard you come here now and again. Figured you'd be needing a little drinky tonight.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: You a reporter?

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: I'm a doctor, but I think I mentioned that. OB-GYN.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Who sent you?

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: I came on my own. After reading about the bombing in Dallas.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Well, if you've got something to tell me, you've got as long as it takes me to hail a cab...

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: And what's that?

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: S.A.C. Darius Michaud never tried or intended to defuse the bomb.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: He just let it explode.

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: What's the question nobody's asking? Why that building? Why not the Federal Building?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: The Federal Building was too well guarded.

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: No. They put the bomb in the building across the street because it DID have federal offices. The Federal Emergency Management Agency had a provisional medical quarantine office there. Which is where the bodies were found. But that's the thing...

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: Those people were already dead.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Before the bomb went off?

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: That's what I'm saying.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Michaud was a twenty-two year veteran of the bureau --

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: Michaud was a patriot. The men he's loyal to know their way around Dallas. They blew that building to hide something. Maybe something even they couldn't predict.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: You're saying they destroyed an entire building to hide the bodies of three firemen...?

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: And one little boy.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: I think you're full of shit.

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: Do you?

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: See this bullshit...? Somebody knows I'm talking to you.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Not according to the men in blue.

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: What is it? Kiddie porn again? Sexual battery of a patient? I've had my license taken away in three states.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: They want to discredit you -- for what?

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: For what? Because I'm a dangerous man. Because I know too much about the truth.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: You mean that apocalyptic trash you write? I knew your name was familiar. I just didn't know why.

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: You know my work?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Dr. Kurtzweil, I'm not interested in bigoted ideas about race or genocide. I don't believe in the Elders of Zion, the Knights Templar, the Bilderburg Group or in a oneworld Jew run government --

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: I don't either, but it sure sells books.

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: I was right about Dallas. Wasn't I, Agent Mulder?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: I picked up the historical document of the venality and hypocrisy of the American government. The daily newspaper.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: You said the firemen and the boy were found in the temporary offices of the Federal Emergency Management Agency. Why?

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: According to the newspaper, FEMA had been called out to manage an outbreak of the Hanta virus. Are you familiar with the Hanta virus, Agent Mulder?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: It was a deadly virus spread by field mice in the Southwest U.S. several years ago.

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: And are you familiar with FEMA? What the Federal Emergency Management Agency's real power is? FEMA allows the White House to suspend constitutional government upon declaration of a national emergency. To create a non-elected government. Think about that.  What is an agency with such broad sweeping power doing managing a small viral outbreak in suburban Texas?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Are you saying it wasn't such a small outbreak?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: What was it?

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: When we were young men in the military, your father and I were recruited for a project. They told us it was biological warfare. A virus. There were rumors about its origins.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: What killed those men?

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: What killed them I won't even write about. I tell you, they'd do more than just harass me. They have the future to protect.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: I'll know soon enough.

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: What killed those men can't be identified in simple medical terms. My god, we can't even wrap our minds around something as obvious as HIV. We have no context for what killed those men, or any appreciation of the scale in which it will be unleashed in the future. Of how it will be transmitted; of the environmental factors involved.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: A plague?

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: The plague to end all plagues, Agent Mulder. A silent weapon for a quiet war. The systematic release of an indiscriminate organism for which the men who will bring it on still have no cure. They've been working on this for fifty years. While the rest of the world was fighting gooks and commies these men have been secretly negotiating a planned Armageddon.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Negotiating with whom?

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: I think you know. The timetable has been set. It will happen on a holiday, when people are away from their homes. When our elected officials are at their resorts or out of the country. The President will declare a state of emergency, at which time all federal agencies, all government will come under the power of the Federal Emergency Management Agency. FEMA, Agent Mulder. The secret government.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: And they tell me I'm paranoid.

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: Something's gone wrong -- something unanticipated. Go back to Dallas and dig. Or you're only going to find out like the rest of the country, Agent Mulder. When it's too late.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: How can I reach you?

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: You can't.

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: You found something?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Yes. On the Texas border. Some kind of experiment. Something they excavated was brought there in tanker trucks.

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: I'm not sure. A virus --

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: -- You saw this experiment?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: What did it look like?

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: A transportation system. Transgenic crops. The pollen genetically altered to carry a virus.

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: That would be my guess.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Your guess?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: You told me you had answers.

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: Yeah, well I don't have them all.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: You've been using me --

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: I've been using you?!

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: You didn't know my father --

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: I told you -- he and I were old friends --

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: You're a liar. You lied to me to gather information for you. For your goddamn books. Didn't you?

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: You'd be shit out of luck if not for me. You saw what you saw because I led you to it. I'm putting my ass on the line for you.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Your ass? I just got chased across Texas by two black helicopters.

turns.speaker: KURTZWEIL
turns.text: And why do you think it is you're standing here talking to me? These people don't make mistakes, Agent Mulder.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Mulder -- it's me --

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Where are you, Scully?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I'm on the roof.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Did you find something?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: No. I haven't.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: What's wrong, Scully?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I've just climbed twelve floors. I'm hot and thirsty and I'm wondering, to be honest, what I'm doing here.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: You're looking for a bomb.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I know that. But the threat was called in for the Federal Building across the street.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: I think they have that covered.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Mulder... when a terrorist bomb threat is called in, the logical purpose of providing this information is to allow us to find the bomb. The rational object of terrorism is to promote terror. If you'd study model behavioral pattern in virtually every case where a threat has turned up an explosive device. If we don't act in accordance with that data -- if you ignore it as we have done -- the chances are great that if here actually is a bomb we might not find it. Lives could be lost --

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Mulder...?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: What happened to playing a hunch?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Jesus, Mulder...

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: The element of surprise, Scully. Random acts of unpredictability. If we fail to anticipate the unforeseen or expect the unexpected in a universe of infinite possibilities, we find ourselves at the mercy of anyone or anything that cannot be programmed, categorized or easily referenced...

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I know you're bored in this assignment, but unconventional thinking is only going to get you into trouble now.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: How's that?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: You've got to quit looking for what isn't there. They've closed the X-Files. There's procedure to be followed here. Protocol.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: What do you say we call in a bomb threat for Houston. I think it's free beer night at the Astrodome.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Now what?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: It's locked?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Had you.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: No you didn't.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Oh yeah. Had you big time.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I saw your face, Mulder. There was a moment of panic.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Panic? Have you ever seen me panic, Scully?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I just did. You're buying.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Alright... what'll it be: Coke, Pepsi? A saline IV?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Something sweet.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Scully...

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Scully, I found the bomb.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Where are you, Mulder?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: I'm in the vending room.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Scully, get somebody to open this door.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Nice try, Mulder.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Mulder? Tell me this is a joke.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Thirteen fifty nine, thirteen fifty eight, thirteen fifty seven...

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: ...thirteen fifty six...

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Hang on. I'm gonna get you out of there.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Scully?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Mulder. Move away from the door. We're coming through it.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Something's not right...

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: -- Mulder! Get in the car!

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Whatever you told them in there, you don't have to protect me.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: All I told them was the truth.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: They're trying to divide us on this, Scully. We can't let them.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: They have divided us, Mulder. They're splitting us up.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: What? What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I meet with the OPR day after tomorrow for remediation and reassignment...

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I think you must have an idea. They cited a history of problems relating back to 1993.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: They were the ones that put us together.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Because they wanted me to invalidate your work, your investigations into the paranormal. But I think this goes deeper than that.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: This isn't about you, Scully. They're doing this to me.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: They're not doing this, Mulder.  I left behind a career in medicine because I thought I might make a difference at the FBI. When they recruited me they told me women made up nine percent of the bureau. I felt this was not an impediment, but an opportunity to distinguish myself. But it hasn't turned out that way. And now, if I were to be transferred to Omaha, or Wichita or some field office where I'm sure I could rise, it just doesn't hold the interest for me it once did. Not after what I've seen and done.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: You're... quitting?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: There's really no reason left for me to stay anymore.  Maybe you should ask yourself if your heart's still in it, too.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: I wake you?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Why not? It's three AM.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Are you drunk, Mulder?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: I was until about an hour ago.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Is that before or after you got the idea to come here?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: What are you implying, Scully?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I thought you may have gotten drunk and decided to come here to talk me out of quitting.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Is that what you'd like me to do?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Go home, Mulder. It's late.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Get dressed, Scully.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Mulder -- what are you doing?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Just get dressed. I'll explain on the way.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: This is one of the firemen who died in Dallas?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: According to this tag.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: And you're looking for?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: It's like jelly.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: There's some kind of cellular breakdown. It's completely edematous.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: And there's been no autopsy performed. There's no Y incision here; no internal exam.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: You're telling me the cause of death on the report is false. That this man didn't die from an explosion, or from flying debris.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I don't know what killed this man. I'm not sure if anybody else could claim to either.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: You knew this man didn't die at the bomb site before we got here.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: I'd been told as much.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: You're saying the bombing was a cover-up. Of what?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: I don't know. But I have a hunch what you're going to find here isn't anything that can be categorized or easily referenced.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Mulder, this is going to take some time, and somebody's going to figure out soon enough we're not even supposed to be here.  I'm in serious violation of medical ethics.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: We're being blamed for these deaths. Scully, I want to know what this man died of. Don't you?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Why are you whispering?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I can't really talk right now.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: What did you find?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Evidence of a massive infection.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: What kind of infection?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Scully -- listen to me. I'm going home, then I'm booking a flight to Dallas. I'm getting you a ticket, too.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Mulder --

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: I need you there with me. I need your expertise on this. The bomb we found was meant to destroy those bodies and whatever they were infected by.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I've got a hearing tomorrow --

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: -- I'll have you back for it, Scully. Maybe with evidence that could blow that meeting away.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Mulder -- I can't -- I'm already way past the point of common sense here --

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: You said you weren't coming?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I wasn't planning on it. Particularly after spending a half hour in cold storage this morning. But I got a better look at the blood and tissue samples I took from the firemen.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: What did you find?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Something I couldn't show to anyone else. Not without more information. And not without causing the kind of attention I'd just as soon avoid right now.  The virus those men were infected with contains a protein coat I've never seen before. What it did to them it did extremely fast. And unlike the AIDS virus or any other aggressive strain, it survives very nicely outside the body.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: How was it contracted?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: That I don't know. But if it's through simple contact of blood to blood, and if it doesn't respond to conventional treatments, it could be a serious health threat.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: He didn't mention a park.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: This is where he marked on the map, Scully. Where he says those fossils were unearthed.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I don't see any evidence of an archeological or any other kind of digsite. Not even a sewer or a storm drain.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: You're sure the fossils you looked at showed the same signs of deterioration you saw in the fireman's body in the morgue?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: The bone was porous, as if the virus of the causative microbe were digesting it.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: And you've never seen anything like that?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: No.  It didn't show up on any of the immunohistochemical tests --

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: This looks like new grass to you?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: It looks pretty green for this climate.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Ground's dry about an inch down. Somebody just laid this down. Very recently, I'd say.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: All the equipment is brand new.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: No irrigation system. Somebody's covering their tracks.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Unmarked tanker trucks... what are archaeologists hauling out in tanker trucks?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I don't know, Mulder.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: And where are they going with it?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: That's the first question to answer, if we're going to find them.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: What are my choices?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: About a hundred miles of nothing in each direction.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Where would they be going?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: We've got two choices. One of them is wrong.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: You think they went left?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I don't know why I think they went right.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Hey, I was right about the bomb, wasn't I?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: This is great. This is fitting.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I've got to be in Washington D.C. in eleven hours for a hearing -- the outcome of which might possibly affect one of the biggest decisions of my life. And here I am standing out in the middle of nowhere Texas, chasing phantom tanker trucks.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: We're not chasing trucks, we're chasing evidence --

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: -- of what exactly?!

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: That bomb in Dallas was allowed to go off, to hide something: bodies infected with a virus you detected yourself.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: They haul gas in tanker trucks, they haul oil in tanker trucks -- they don't haul viruses in tanker trucks.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Yeah, well they may this one.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: What do you mean by haul?  What are you not telling me here?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: This virus -- it...

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Mulder --

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: It may be extraterrestrial.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I don't believe this. I don't fucking believe this.  Y'know, I've been here... I've been here one too many times with you, Mulder.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Been where?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Pounding down some dirt road in the middle of the night. Chasing some elusive truth on a dim hope, only to find myself standing right where I am right now: at another dead end --

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: What do you think it is?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: I have no idea.
